content: Which famous American author wrote the novel "The Great Gatsby" that was later adapted into several films?

F. Scott Fitzgerald is the famous American author who wrote the novel "The Great Gatsby." This novel has indeed been adapted into several films over the years, with different directors and actors bringing their own interpretations to the story. The book is considered a classic of 20th-century literature and is widely studied in schools and universities. It explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess, using the story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.
